group_1.textLeft: Strange phenomena keep occurring in the@Kamihama of this timeline.
But ONLY in this timeline.
This must be something irregular that@happened only once.

group_1.textRight: Yes.
If my suspicions are correct...
It's a side effect of the magic used by the@other "you".

group_1.textLeft: What does that mean?

group_1.textRight: Your magic...
With it, you can change the past's@possibilities.
We see your magic as an ability to cross@between multiple parallel worlds.
You wanted to find a way to save Madoka.
So, you repeatedly traveled back in time to@find a way to save her.
Was the past where you'd awaken the same,@every time, down to the smaller details?
Did you notice anything different, however@small?

group_1.textLeft: Well...

group_1.textRight: The changes may have been difficult to@notice.
They may have been so minute that you didn't@even notice them at all.

group_1.textLeft: So what if they were?
The change in Kamihama certainly isn't.
None of the pasts I've experienced have had@anything remotely likely it.

group_1.textRight: Have you ever heard of something called@the "butterfly effect"?
It's a phenomenon where the tiniest change@dramatically alters the entire world.
The flutter of a butterfly's wings, for@example, could result in a typhoon.
Every time you return to the past, you may@be causing small ripples in time and space.
Let's assume that those ripples create@slightly different parallel worlds.
When they're created, the changes may be@insignificant.
The flutter of a butterfly's wings, or@someone unknowingly kicking a tiny pebble.

group_1.textCenter: (Did I just kick something by accident?)
(I wonder what it was? I didn't see it...)

group_1.textLeft: You think that's what caused it?
A tiny difference like that is what created@the irregular situation in Kamihama?

group_1.textRight: It's possible.
For example, a non-Magical Girl could happen@to meet me because of the small change.
Even if she wouldn't form a contract in@other worlds, she might do so in this one.

group_1.textLeft: And that leads to more changes?
Those small changes then grow and expand@into one big irregularity?

group_1.textRight: I'm only hypothesizing.
But, among the Magical Girls the other@"you" met...
There were some who never became Magical@Girls in our world.
That much is true.

group_1.textLeft: Do you know something I don't?

group_1.textRight: I don't know what happened. I'm just stating@some possibilities.
So, back to the irregularities in Kamihama.
If the phenomena in Kamihama are a side@effect of "your" magic...
Then that explains that orb of light that@looked so unstable.
That orb of memories from that world looked@more unstable than the others.

group_1.textLeft: Because...that world was created from a tiny@ripple of change?
And it became a parallel world that shouldn't@otherwise exist...?

group_1.textRight: Exactly.
I also suspect that Madoka can't interfere@with that particular world.

group_1.textLeft: Why?

group_1.textRight: The memory you saw was just one possibility.
It's essentially just a dream.
Not even Madoka can meddle with it unless the@outcome is made certain.

group_1.textLeft: The other "me"...
Is there a chance she could save Madoka?

group_1.textRight: I'm not sure.
Maybe you can watch the rest of your dream,@and see what happens at the end.
Homura Akemi, are you curious about these@other possibilities for saving Madoka?
Do you want to see what happens, had you@taken a path you didn't take?

group_1.textLeft: (I'm starting to see it...)
(More memories from the other "me" are@flowing into my mind...)
...[chara:200200:eyeClose_1]
